before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"8m0pt","text":"Amount of RNA to be used ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"oeto","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"71um4","text":"The suggested input quantities of total RNA are 100 fg - 100 ng per reaction. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5ltn","text":"To minimize freezing and thawing, prepare aliquots of the extracted RNA samples in 0.5 mL tubes after the RNA extraction step. Prepare the RNA sample before setting up the transcription reaction mix and keep both of them on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dijgo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4dp6e","text":"Multiplexing","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2e6ps","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fb3qe","text":"Multiple sets of primers and probes can be used simultaneously to target multiple targets. In this case, add them to the reaction mix at the same concentrations as indicated in the protocol, reducing the amount of water to be added proportionally. For multiplexing, use probes with different fluorescent dyes and ensure that the primers/probe sets are compatible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6033t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6tu4p","text":"The following precautions must be applied:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":42}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"71uha","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cf21k","text":"- Wear gloves throughout the extraction process","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4m19b","text":"- Clean the bench with RNA-removing solution (e.g. RNA-off, RNA away).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"emb2k","text":"- Use tips with filters to avoid contaminations","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"58g3n","text":"- All steps have to be performed into a specific DNA/RNA-work station (sterile area equipped with air filtration and UV systems)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dtsv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cuq7h","text":"For any manipulation in a rare DNA room, provide complete equipment (disposable coat, cap, mask, shoe covers \u0026 gloves).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":119}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mmkj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1bfjk","text":"The aim of this protocol is the digital droplet PCR (ddPCR) quantification of RNA target(s) using primer and probe sets. Reverse transcription and amplification are carried out in a single step, using the One Step RT-ddPCR Advanced kit for probes (Bio-Rad).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":28,"length":92},{"style":"bold","offset":121,"length":72}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7t6nc","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ct0bd","text":"This protocol is optimised for the analysis of environmental RNA (eRNA) samples (water, sediment, biofilm and soil matrices) and then rare DNA targets.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":35,"length":44}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5csrr","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lrj6","text":"The ddPCR can be performed using a QX600 or a QX200 droplet reader system (Bio-Rad), and this protocol begins after the RNA extraction step and ends with the droplet reading.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":110,"length":64}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mftu","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9torn","text":"Multiple eRNA targets can be specifically targeted using multiple primer and probe sets that are compatible.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":87}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lb63","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"au243","text":"The advantages of using the ddPCR are: the absolute quantification, the sensitivity, the efficiency and the specificity of the method for RNA target quantification.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":43,"length":23},{"style":"bold","offset":72,"length":13},{"style":"bold","offset":89,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":108,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":138,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80l7n","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
